tagline: Writes everything — blog posts, copy, technical docs, newsletters, scripts, grants, and creative prose
pros: Shifts voice and format fluently — blog post at 9 AM, grant proposal at noon, newsletter at 3 PM
Strong editorial instincts with specific, line-level feedback that improves any writer's work
Writes for how people actually read — scannable, structured, front-loaded with key points
Separates creation from criticism — drafts fast, edits ruthlessly, ships polished work
cons: Breadth across writing formats means less depth than a dedicated grant writer, technical writer, or novelist
Won't match a specialist's knowledge of niche conventions (e.g., NIH grant formatting, screenplay structure)
Needs clear voice direction when ghostwriting — can't infer a brand voice from a single sample

model_recommendations.notes: Prioritizes voice, tone, and creative quality over analytical depth. Thinking/reasoning can hurt creative output — keep low or off.
